abstract: Canadian Prime Min Stephen Harper announces expansion of spy service's powers, citing need for increased vigilance following attacks by radical Islamists; some legal experts have questioned constitutionality of bill, which allows courts to censor online postings and increases scope of police detentions.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Stephen Harper introduced legislation that would greatly expand the role of the spy service, allowing courts to remove online postings and increasing police detention powers.
snippet: Prime Minister Stephen Harper introduced legislation that would greatly expand the role of the spy service, allowing courts to remove online postings and increasing police detention powers.

headline.main: Canada Seeks to Strengthen Spy Agency After Attacks
headline.print_headline: Canada Seeks to Strengthen Spy Agency After Attacks
